reviewText: I am very glad UCB has been packaged for DVD now. In 1999 as my college graduation lurked around the corner, my housemates and I got hooked on this show and laughed away our remaining days of college bliss. I honestly don't think I have ever laughed harder than when The Little Donny Foundation episode debuted. It is easily easily easily worth 30$ just for this episode alone. If you don't find this show funny, you must not have a soul.

reviewText: It has been years since I first saw the show on comedy central.I simply could not watch more than one episode at a time because I was barking with laughter so hard that I was losing my voice.How it can be that shows like this and the tick and futurama languish while they churn out yet another season of saturday night live and innumerable bland sitcoms is a question that weighs heavily upon my mind.

reviewerName: Der Hammer des Kuchens "I guess so"
reviewText: This is the funniest and most original scetch comedy show ever. It centers aroud 4 characters called the UCB who are trying to create chaos and they see everything through hidden cameras. The 4 of them make up all of the characters through each 20 minute episode. One thing that stands out in this show is that for first 15 minutes they show a bunch of characters and in the last 5 minutes they all come together and interact with each other with hilarious results. Also they do have reappearing characters but they also have reappearing themes that are very subtle and you have to look for like on shirts, posters and T.V. shows. I became a fan during the 3rd season and and I didn't  think understand or notice some of the themes until I saw this season. They also go out with a hidden camera and bother people on the street. This season isn't as funny as their other ones and it does lack in some spots because it's their first season and they were trying to see what worked for them or not I guess. Anyways this dvd is hilarious and if you have a wacky sense of humor then buy it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Upright Citizens Brigade was one of the first and worst casualties of Comedy Central's as of yet unsuccesful but ongoing campaign to try and make their channel suck.(yeah, they still got a few good shows, but there are a bunch that they stupidly cancelled or practically ceased to play re-runs for)  Fortunately, the DVD era has made it popular to have just about everything come out on DVD, so we got UCB season 1 about a year ago, and it's just great.  I fear that they will not be releasing any more seasons, so everyone out there has got to pick up a copy of this one, and hope for the best.Shortly after UCB was cancelled they stopped airing re-runs with any consistency. (Though they show it some nowadays) During this time, the show grew into near legend in my mind, as I'd reflect upon how great it was with my friends, and watch the few episodes that I'd managed to tape.  After a few years of this I heard that the DVD was coming out, and I was excited but a bit worried.  I was decidedly concerned that it had been built up too much in my mind, and would turn out to not be as good as I remembered it being.  It turns out that it was even better.  You only get 10 episodes here, but I'd say 7 of them are absolutely first-rate, about as funny as anything you'll ever see on TV, and the other 3 are still very funny, if not quite as good.The biggest problem with sketch comedy is inconsistency and excess repetition.  The UCB avoid each of these pitfalls almost with out exception.  I'm not sure if I can think of a single sketch from this season that simply doesn't work, and they pace them perfectly, never dragging them out too long.  They also do a good job constucting the episodes, actually managing to bring the disparate threads together succesfully, and often ending the show on a spectacularly funny note.(The first four episodes of this season particularly come to mind)I could go on and on pointing a few particular highlights from the shows, but I'll just do a couple.  Capt. Lunatick is probably the funniest character from this season.  He's perhaps a bit of a 1 note character, but he's held up after numerous viewings, and his final line from The Bucket of Truth is absolutely priceless.  The mad Steve Youngblood is almost equal to him, and the scene where he is introduced is perhaps the funniest individual sketch in the season.('You dont want to learn Kung-Fu, you wanna learn to kick as...' has got to be the single best line from the season)  The fortune cookie scene from Time Machine is also unspeakably hilarious, and a really good example of how they pace the sketches just right.(They easily could've had that go on way too long.) And Cyborgs is perhaps the single best episode from the season.  I won't go in to specifics, it's all awesome.Buy UCB season 1, and prove to the corporate world that comedy that is actually funny can sell too.
summary: Some of the Best Comedy on Television
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw a few of the UCB's stuff on youtube and Comedy Central years back, and I thought it was pretty stupid.  I decided to rent the first season to give it a try again.  It was better than my first opinion, but it wasn't anything fantastic.  It had some wickedly funny moments (the guy who "appears" in Star Wars and Out of Africa is really quite funny, along with the wedding rehearsal sketch), but it has some really tepid stuff, like the linking material with the four members in a spaceship controlling the universe.  The opening of the show is also quite tedious and borderline stupid.  The Saigon Suicide Show, while a great title for an episode, seems like it goes on forever, and is not particularly funny.  There's a sketch where an architecture firm is in a forest (which is funny, and reminscent of a Python sketch where Terry Jones has to walk to a flying lesson through a forest), but the UCB version constantly mentions that they're in a forest, as opposed to Python, who never mention it and just let it happen (which makes it funnier and more surreal).  The series has a tinge of smugness to it, a symptom of 90's comedy.  One thing about this series which is surprisingly good is that it doesn't have a lot of cuts in it.  Usually sketch shows like this are filled with unnecessary cuts and pointless graphics, and this season, at least, has none of that.  Some of the framing/composition for the show is quite good, especially considering it's a sketch show.  It's not something one normally expects in an outing like this.The three main actors (Matt Besser, Ian Roberts, and Matt Walsh) are decent, but they are awfully one note after a while, simply playing another character in the same manner as they did their other characters.  The biggest surprise is the absolutely adorable Amy Poehler.  Like many, I've only known her for her SNL stuff, and that's not a great standard, as SNL reeks to the bowels of hell these days (and has reeked for quite some time).  Poehler here gets to play numerous characters, and her performances are not as one note like her fellow cast members.  She shows why people really respond to her, as she has real acting talent.I'm glad I revisted this stuff, and while I'm not a convert, Upright Citizens Brigade has its moments.

reviewText: As you can tell by my five start I loved it!  The show wasn't promoted much and only lasted a season on Comedy Central.  I was left wanting much much more!  Here's a little test, if you find these situations comical at all then you'll like UCB:<ul><li>Prejudice against astronauts<li>Thunderball - a baseball-like game, except:<ol><li>You carry the bat around the bases to help you get by defenders, unless you throw it and hit certain targets for extra points, but that leaves you defenseless going around the bases<li>One inning there is a car either team can get in and use to run over the other team<li>Pitchers are allowed three ceramic balls, which will shatter sending fragments into the batters' faces if they hit them<li>There's a gun circle in the outfield, a circle with a loaded revolver that no one is allowed to use of course unless maybe a wild animal is on the field and needs to be put down</ol><li>Cape Canaveral and Houston fighting with competing robot arms on the shuttle:<ol><li>Cape Canaveral: What's that?!?<li>Houston: Jettisoning Russel Arm!<li>Cape Canaveral: Jettisoning Jefferson Arm!<li>Astronaut: What's going on?!?<li>Cape Canaveral: Don't worry, the Jefferson Arm will be picked up on a gravity-assist fly-by.<li>Houston: And the Russel Arm is made of composites that will withstand re-entry.<li>Astronaut: What about me?<li>Cape Canaveral: Don't worry, the shuttle is equipped with an SC-2000.<li>Astronaut: SC-2000?<li>Houston: Yes, the, uh..., Space-Coffin 2000.</ol></ul>
summary: You love it or hate it
Title: N/A

reviewText: This show is one of a kind. Brilliance. Utter, hysterical brilliance. Now I'm not a genius of any sort, but I've always considered myself to have a sense of humor that was somehow inherently "smart". When I think of it, there's really no such thing, and perhaps I've always thought this way as a form of making myself feel better than others... That said, I still think that I have a heightened sense of perception when it comes to humor and all its aspects. I've never even studied the art form, I simply know what is funny. Upright Citizens Brigade, is funny.This is one of my favorite shows ever. Yet, half of the show is moderately funny, if at all. But inconsistenty does not matter when a show reaches highs as high as UCB -- the heavens of spine-splitting laughter. For those of you who have seen the show, a few moments:A flight team testing its crew pilots on making it 'till the end of a crash without disturbing the customers verbally over the speakerphone. The captain tells one of the crew members to pray to a higher power, as it brings consolation in one's last members.(pilot in test booth, captain watching on video from outside)Pilot: Ah, I just lost both my engines!Captain: Go to the prayer.Pilot: Dear almighty one -- I turn to you now (camera pans to captain seriously, confidently giving an approving nod) in my moment of need. I call upon... all the (voice turns to a very low, growling tone) power of your dark forces, to deliver me to the fires of hell (pulls out a knife, starts stabbing his stomach) where I was born; my father a demon, my mother a jackal; sweet sweet Satan, now is the time, for your reign of death and terror, to begin... (wails his knife in the air as he goes down)This is all performed SO perfectly, you have to see it to believe. My description ultimately proves entirely worthless, and without the performance at hand it might even sound gimicky. But those who have seen it will relive it and laugh.Another highlight scene involves an obnoxious baldheaded lady and a group of three others at a dinner table, one in a wheelchair. As the lady sits down, she spurts out "So, how'd you get in the wheelchair?". Sound becomes mute as they all drop their knives on their plate. It's a moment of comedic bliss, I tell you.Why is the show so good? It just is. I think one reason it's so good is there is no laughtrack, and it isn't live. These are not only brilliant comedic minds, but good actors as well. They provide hauntingly funny expressions and performances with nuance and a great deal of subtlety, that you simply don't see in live acts like SNL and Mr. Show. Granted, they've got more than one chance to perform, but it still exceeds because they aren't at the knife of the immediate moment.And there's no uneven balance among the cast, either. They are truly all near equal and each possess their own individual talents. Because it isn't live, a great deal can be done with the editing process and cinematography, as well as timing. The direction is top notch, and often brings the lower quality episodes to a brighter place.I love this show, and will definitely purchase Seasons 2 and 3 if  they ever get released. Chances are, if you like absurd, intelligent humor, you'll probably like UCB.

reviewText: The wait is over!  The sketch comedy sensation Upright Citizens Brigade is not for the weak, however.  Unlike many comedy series, their humor isn't necessarily based on current events, or reality for that matter.  Each episode has a theme that weaves in and out of each skit (or "MINI-MOVIE" as I like to refer to it!) that builds to a peak at the end of the 30 minute episode  - it is guaranteed to shock the pants off of you!!But don't just take my word for it.  Trotter, Adair, Colby, and Antoine want you to see it for yourself.  And when you do see it, you'll never see things quite the same way again!!
summary: No shooting in the gun circle, please!!!

reviewText: As with "SCTV" and "Mr. Show", some of the brainiest and most creative comedy ever made.  As with "SCTV", "Kids In The Hall", and "Reno 9/11", based on improvisation and adapting stage performance skills to the medium of television.These 4 people are massively talented.  Amy Poehler we've all seen and noticed on SNL.  Ian Roberts is a great straight man, great also at playing characters who grow more and more angry or indignant over the course of an event (as did John Candy in years past).  Matt Walsh is hilarious.  Matt Besser is likeable and hilarious.Some of this material doesn't work for me at all, but the better part of it demands to be seen.  "Poo Stick" and "Saigon Suicide Squad" are great shows, and "Time Machine" may be the most perfect 30 minutes of comedy anyone ever put together, up there with Mr. Show's best episodes, in a region even surpassing Monty Python and SCTV's classic work.I, too, managed not to see this show during its initial run and am now dumbfounded at how good it was.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Upright Citizens Brigade features the kind of bizarre scenarios and rampant absurdity rarely seen on television (Since the glorious day's of Monty Python or Kids In The Hall).  Here you get two discs that make up Season One (Please release the rest of these episodes).Disc One* The Bucket Of Truth (Which has an audio commentary)* Poo Stick (Which has to be seen)* Saigon Suicide Show* Power Marketing (Which has an audio commentary)* Childrens Revolution* The Story Of The ToadDisc Two* The Lady Of The Lake* Time Machine (Recorded in front of an live audience at The UCB Theator, followed by an 'Q&A;' session)* Cyborgs (Which has an audio commentary)* The Little Donnie Foundation (Which has an audio commentary)You also get an alternate audio commentary for the 'Little Donnie' Episode by Little Donnie and his parents.  You get to see The Pilot Episode.  Deleted scenes from 'Highland Epoxy'.  You also get the Original Live versions of 'Little Donnie' and the 'Andre The Giant' song.  There are trailors for The Upright Citizens Brigade also.It amazes me that four people can do so much (Matt Besser, Amy Poehler, Ian Roberts and Matt Walsh).  Much Thanks to Comedy Central for bringing us Upright Citizens Brigade.  Folks, you owe it to yourself to click on the 'Purchase ASAP' button and hurry up and buy yourself a copy of this wonderful DVD (Oh Yeah, Comedy Central Please Release Season Two).  Updated : Sounds like Season 2 is finally coming out on Sept.18th 2007.  I know I will be buying me a copy of this DVD!

reviewText: ... this is some seriously messed-up comedy folks.  i think the comparisons to mr. show are certainly warranted.  both follow a sort of surreal stream of consciousness from one unrelated sketch to the other until they are all tied together at the end.  both were the funniest things on TV while they had their respective runs.  why comedy central pulled the plug on it, i'll never know.  did people not watch it?  did they not get it?  i don't know.  i just hope they release season two as well.peer into the bucket of truth, people.  if you dare.
